McIlroy has had success in other major tournaments, including the U.S. Open, the PGA Championship, and The Open, but he feels it would be disappointing to end his career without a Masters victory. He has learned from his past experiences, including the collapse in 2011, and used the golf course as a sanctuary to escape distractions. He plans to use this strategy again to handle the pressure and hype surrounding Augusta.',

" The passage covers various trending stories from the past week. In New York, four rainbows appeared in the sky after a heavy rainfall, captured in a photo by Amanda Curtis. In rural China, there is a growing trend of hiring exotic dancers for wakes, but this has been targeted in a crackdown on vice. Actor Robert Downey Jr. became agitated during an interview when asked about his private life. A new trend of lip plumping, inspired by Kylie Jenner, has emerged where people suck on a jar to make their lips look bigger. A prom proposal that referenced bombs was controversial, with the proposer accusing administrators of racism. Ewan McGregor is set to play Lumiere in the new Beauty and the Beast movie, and Johnny Depp's transformation for the Black Mass trailer has generated interest. A pregnant woman announced her pregnancy by referencing The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air, and a military father photobombed his son's photo, both of which were popular on social media.",

" The passage discusses the issue of Foetal Alcohol Syndrome (FAS) in England. Last year, 272 children with FAS were hospitalized. However, experts suggest the actual number of babies affected by their mothers' drinking could be much higher, with at least one in 100 babies in the UK born with learning, behavioral, and physical problems due to alcohol exposure. This equates to about 7,500 babies each year. FAS is a lifelong disability with symptoms including developmental delays and physical deformities. One teenager, Niamh Brown, diagnosed with FAS at age five, struggles with daily tasks and will never live independently. The passage also mentions other medical issues associated with alcohol consumption during pregnancy, such as liver, kidney, and heart problems, cerebral palsy, sight loss, and epilepsy. The government advises pregnant women not to drink alcohol, with a maximum consumption of up to two units no more than twice a week. However, Elizabeth Mitchell from the National Organization for Fetal Alcohol Syndrome believes the guidance should be changed to advise women not to drink at all during pregnancy.",

' Shaun Andrew McKerry, also known as "Boomerang Boy" or "Homing Pigeon Boy," attempted to rob Shildon Post Office and Stores in County Durham while wielding an axe. He was foiled by the shop owner, Sab Dhillon, who tackled him to the ground, and Dhillon\'s wife, Sam, who hit McKerry with a baseball bat, causing him to drop the weapon. The incident occurred on March 15, and McKerry was arrested minutes later by the police. He pleaded guilty to attempted robbery and was sentenced to six years in jail. McKerry, 31, had a history of criminal activity, starting from the age of 12, and was known for always returning to his home after committing a crime.',

' Four British Royal Navy sailors, Joshua Finbow, Craig Stoner, Simon Radford, and Darren Smalley, have been charged with gang rape of a young woman in Nova Scotia, Canada. They were granted bail and must stay in Nova Scotia until trial, live at the Stadacona naval base, surrender their passports, and continue to work for the Royal Navy with their current pay. The alleged assault occurred after a hockey game at the Shearwater naval base. The men were ordered to return to court on May 27 and not contact the victim or six witnesses. They face up to 14 years in prison for sexual assault causing bodily harm and group sexual assault. The investigation is ongoing, and forensic tests could lead to additional charges. The Royal Navy will decide how to employ them during the court process.',

" A mother's son, RJ Jackson, has Netherton's Syndrome, a rare congenital skin disease affecting only 70 people worldwide. The condition makes RJ's skin appear red, inflamed, and scaly, which led a stranger to mistakenly report his mother for child abuse. Valerie Jackson, RJ's mother, faces regular taunts and ignorant comments from people accusing her of harming her son. Even children with the syndrome are often denied entry to play centers and become targets of bullying. The syndrome has no cure, but symptoms can improve over time. RJ's skin needs constant care with creams to ease his painful symptoms. Despite the challenges, Valerie considers her son beautiful and hopes that as he grows, his condition will become better known to reduce negative comments.",

' The adverts for Protein World\'s "Are you beach body ready?" campaign, featuring a bikini-clad model, are being taken down after facing backlash from feminists, body image campaigners, and commuters in London. The adverts have been criticized for promoting an unhealthy body image and suggesting that only women who look like the model in the advert can go to the beach. A petition to remove the adverts received over 50,000 signatures, and the Advertising Standards Authority received over 200 complaints. Protein World has defended the campaign, stating that the image is unphotoshopped and that they are a fitness brand. However, the company has faced criticism for its blunt responses to complaints on social media. The removal of the adverts comes as a protest organized against Protein World in Hyde Park gains momentum. Sales of protein powder are increasing in the UK, with expectations of reaching Â£358m by 2017.',

' Rail firms, including First Great Western (FGW), are facing criticism for planning to increase some fares by up to 87% starting May 17, despite main party leaders promising to freeze prices. This increase affects unregulated fares, which make up half of the total revenue for train companies. FGW is implementing these changes to align the North Cotswolds route fares with other services. The prime minister, David Cameron, has intervened by writing to FGW to request an urgent review of the planned fare hike on the route through his Witney constituency. Other sharp price hikes include a 24.5% increase for an anytime return between Stafford and Liverpool, and a 22% increase for an anytime first-class day return on Virgin from Manchester to Stoke. Virgin has defended the rise, stating that the vast majority of its price hikes affected Virgin trains-only fares, which are at least 20% cheaper than tickets offered by rival firms.',
' Former soldier John Young, 6',

" Tom Poynton, the 25-year-old Derbyshire wicketkeeper, has signed a one-year contract extension after making a successful return from injury. Poynton missed the entire 2014 season due to leg injuries from a car accident that resulted in his father's death. He underwent an ankle operation and made his playing comeback during Derbyshire's pre-season tour in Abu Dhabi. Graeme Welch, Derbyshire's elite performance director, praised Poynton's character and work ethic during his recovery and is pleased to see him back on the field. The new contract is expected to give Poynton confidence to perform well in the 2016 season, as he has shown good form since his return to training.",

" Harley Renshaw, a five-year-old boy from Stretford, was diagnosed with an aggressive form of cancer called neuroblastoma in his kidney, lungs, bones, and neck. During his radiotherapy treatment, he wore a superhero mask and costume to feel stronger and braver. Harley asked to decorate his protective mask like a Ninja Turtle, which gained worldwide attention. After undergoing intensive chemotherapy, a stem cell transplant, and radiotherapy, Harley has been given the all-clear by doctors and is now cancer-free. He will continue to have regular check-ups. Harley's story led to him receiving a Little Star Award from Cancer Research UK and becoming the face of their Kids and Teens campaign.\n\nNeuroblastoma is a rare and aggressive cancer affecting specialized nerve cells in the nervous system and other tissues, with fewer than 100 children diagnosed in the UK each year. Most children diagnosed are younger than five years old. The symptoms vary depending on the tumor's location and can include tiredness, loss of appetite, bone pain, and difficulty swallowing or passing urine. Treatment typically involves surgery, chemotherapy, antibody treatment, and radiotherapy. The cause of neuroblastoma is unknown.",

" Tim Sherwood, manager of Aston Villa, has advised 19-year-old star player Jack Grealish to focus on his club career instead of worrying about his international future. Grealish, who was instrumental in Villa's FA Cup semi-final win over Liverpool, is being courted by both England and the Republic of Ireland for international selection. Sherwood is more concerned about Grealish securing a place in the Villa first team and believes that the more opportunities he gets, the better he will become. Grealish's father, Kevin, has also urged his son to concentrate on his club football first before making a decision about his international future. Grealish is expected to choose between the two countries at the end of the season.",

' The passage discusses the trend of traveling by private jet, which is a luxury for the wealthy and comes with high landing fees. The busiest weekends for private jet companies are during major sporting events like the Super Bowl and Monaco Grand Prix. The passage also mentions the highest landing fees at various airports worldwide, with Haneda Airport in Tokyo, Japan being the most expensive at $6,850 (Â£4,559) per landing. Other airports with high landing fees include Narita International Airport in Tokyo, Kansai International Airport in Osaka, Japan, Dublin Airport in Ireland, and Bristol Airport in England. The passage concludes by stating that private jet companies have seen a rise in private flights, with 2.5 million in the US and 705,000 in Europe in 2013.',

' The passage describes a video of two dogs, Cooper the Labrador and Daisy, at a McDonald\'s drive-thru where Cooper quickly gobbles up an ice cream cone while Daisy takes a few ladylike licks. The owner, Katie Gallegos, takes them for weekly treats and ensures Daisy eats first due to Cooper\'s fast eating habits. The video has been watched over 7 million times, with some viewers praising and others criticizing the ice cream treat. Gallegos, who runs a dog resort, defends the action, stating that Cooper is an athlete in great health and had a similar weekly ice cream treat until the age of 19. Another video shows the dogs at a Starbucks enjoying a "pup-uccino," with Cooper once again consuming the contents quickly. The Starbucks beverage is confirmed to not contain any coffee and is just whipped cream in a cup.',

" Gary Locke, the interim manager of Kilmarnock Football Club, has been appointed as the team's manager on a permanent basis after signing a three-year deal. Locke, former boss of Heart of Midlothian, joined Kilmarnock as assistant to Allan Johnston last summer. He took over as manager when Johnston resigned in February. Locke has been successful in his interim role, losing only once in seven games. He will officially start his new role after speaking at a press conference on Friday morning.",

' A mother from Eustis, Florida, Jessica Kemp, claims her 5-year-old autistic son, Logan, was threatened with suspension from Seminole County Elementary due to the essential oils he uses, manufactured by Doterra, which help manage his illness. The school alleges the oils are a distraction and smell, but Kemp argues they keep her son calm and focused. Despite receiving a letter from the local school board stating the oils have caused a problem, Kemp intends to continue using them. The Lavender, Chamomile, and Sandalwood scents are used by the family, and Doterra describes their products as beautifully and powerfully fragrant. The Lake County School District has since stated that Logan will not be suspended, citing it as a health issue.',
' A beach-side apartment complex in Westhampton, called the Sandpiper complex, was destroyed by a fire on Wednesday afternoon. The fire spread through 9',

' The passage describes Queen Elizabeth II, who at 88 years old, enjoyed a ride on her black Fell pony, Carltonlima Emma, in Windsor Great Park. The queen has a lifelong love for horses, having first ridden at the age of four, and has owned many horses over the years, including Betsy and Surprise. She is known for not wearing a riding helmet and prefers to wear a silk headscarf instead. The queen breeds several breeds of horses and ponies, including Fell ponies, which have been around since the Neolithic period and are known for their hardiness and gentle nature. The queen\'s love for horses is shared by her grandchildren, who also ride. She has cut back on riding in recent years due to a knee injury but remains an "enthusiastic equestrian" and can often be seen at her Windsor stables.',

" A dispute over noise levels between two neighbors in Brisbane, Australia escalated when 28-year-old Phillip Pama confronted 55-year-old Leon Yeaman, resulting in Yeaman's death by a single punch from Pama. The incident occurred when Yeaman, known for being drunk, playing loud music, and yelling, was making noise in his yard late at night, disturbing Pama, who worked a 3 am shift and was sleeping at the time. Pama, a married father of three with no history of violence, was granted conditional bail and is ordered to surrender his passport, follow a curfew, and report to the local police station twice a week. The case is set to return to court on May 18.",

' Yulia Simonova, a 52-year-old music teacher, attempted to hire a hitman to torture and kill her 15-year-old ex-student, Damian Vanya, after he ended their relationship and started dating a classmate. She offered 100,000 rubles (Â£ 1,400) for the hit. Simonova wanted Vanya to suffer and specified that he should be beaten, have his arms and legs broken, and be left to bleed out. She was arrested during a police sting operation in Shatura, Russia. She now faces 15 years in prison on charges of attempted murder. Vanya is relieved and hopes Simonova will remain in prison.',

" Jose Mourinho, Chelsea football manager, reveals he talks to God daily but never about football or with his wife. He and his family have experience with poverty and have worked as an ambassador with the World Food Programme against hunger. Mourinho tries to separate his professional and family life. He has a strong faith in God, prays daily, and attends church mainly in Portugal. He never prays about football or Chelsea. Despite his arrogant persona, Mourinho claims to be a good person, family man, and friend. He acknowledges making mistakes in his competitive and emotional professional life. Chelsea is currently top of the league and plays struggling QPR this weekend. Mourinho was fined Â£25,000 earlier this season for claiming there was a 'campaign' against Chelsea. His son, Jose Mario, celebrated Chelsea's Capital One Cup victory this year.",

' The passage describes the return of TV legend Bob Barker to "The Price is Right" after eight years. Barker, who hosted the show for 35 years before stepping down in 2007, hosted the first game of the show, "Lucky Seven," on April 1. He appeared spry at 91 years old and handled the hosting duties smoothly despite being away from the show for a long time. Drew Carey, the current host, then took over hosting for the rest of the show.',

" An off-duty Secret Service agent, Arthur Baldwin, was arrested in Washington D.C. at 12:30 AM on Friday and charged with felony attempted burglary and destruction of property. He was arrested on the 3200 block of D Street SE by the Metropolitan Police Department while posted at the Foreign Missions Branch of the Service, which works with the State Department on diplomatic activities. The agency revoked his security clearance and placed him on leave. Baldwin was scheduled for arraignment in the afternoon, but no attorney or contact information was provided. This incident follows another case of misconduct by a high-ranking supervisor, and both are under investigation by the Homeland Security Department's Inspector General. The Secret Service is currently under scrutiny for several recent incidents, including a March 4 incident involving two high-ranking officials driving into a secure area at the White House after a night of drinking.",

" Freelance photographer Atif Saeed, 38, from Lahore, Pakistan, risked his life to capture an image of a hungry lion at a local safari park. Saeed approached the lion to within 10 feet, lying on the ground and using only his camera. The lion became aware of Saeed when the camera's shutter clicked, causing Saeed to quickly retreat to his car. Saeed stated that he wanted to show the character and status of the lion, and described the encounter as a close one.",

' The New York City police are trying to identify a woman who died in Brooklyn last month by releasing images of a tattoo found on her body. The woman, believed to be between 25 and 45 years old, was found unconscious on March 22 and pronounced dead in the Gravesend section of Brooklyn. She had no identification on her, but she had a distinctive tattoo of the name "Monique" on her right leg. The tattoo is depicted as a faded body art of a ribbon within a heart topped with a rose. The cause of her death is still unknown, and anyone with information about the unidentified woman is being asked to contact NYPD Crime Stoppers.',

' A New Zealand couple, Hannah and Alex, built a two-bedroom, solar-powered home on the back of a 1986 Hino flatbed truck due to not being able to afford a full-sized lot after returning to New Zealand from the UK in 2009. The process took them a year and a half, and they now live in the wood and steel home in Nelson, New Zealand, surrounded by nature. The home is nearly self-sufficient, with power coming mostly from solar panels, a wood-fired stove for heat, gas-powered stove and hot water, and water from a nearby spring. The project cost the couple around $25,000.',

' Sharing iPads in class leads to better early literacy test results for kindergarten students, according to a study by Courtney Blackwell at Northwestern University. In a research project involving 352 students in a midwestern suburban school district, Blackwell found that students who shared iPads in class over an academic year scored around 30 points higher than students who used the device on their own or did not have access to iPads. The collaborative learning around the technology, not just the collaboration itself, is believed to be the key factor in the improved test scores. Blackwell will present her findings at the 65th annual conference of the International Communication Association in Puerto Rico. This research contradicts the skepticism of the general secretary of the National Association of Head Teachers regarding the use of technology as a teaching aid in non-IT classes.',

' A piglet in Qionglai City, Sichuan Province, China, was born without its back legs and has become an internet sensation after learning to walk on two feet. Nicknamed "Super Pig," the piglet demonstrates extraordinary balance and determination in the video, which shows it wobbling and searching for food. Villagers have been visiting to see the unique piglet, which belongs to farmer Ms. Duan. Despite being born without its back legs, the two-legged piglet manages to keep up with its littermates who were all born with four legs. This is not the first time an animal with two legs instead of four has gained attention in China, as a rabbit at Liuzhou Zoo also became a star attraction for walking on its front paws.',

" On Sunday, during the IndyCar Grand Prix of Louisiana, Todd Phillips, a pit crew member and front-outside tire changer for Dayle Coyne Racing, was injured when Francesco Dracone's car struck him after Dracone spun while exiting his pit box, clipping Phillips' leg. Phillips was taken to the infield care center, received stitches for a cut on his leg, and was later released. The race took place after hours of rain, causing traction issues for many drivers. Dracone, who is 19 and from Italy, did not finish the race and placed 23rd.",

" A husband, Milton Vieira Severiano, killed his wife, dancer Cicera Alves de Sena, by smashing her head into concrete paving 11 times and shooting her in the face five times. The murder was motivated by jealousy as Severiano was upset about men looking at his wife. The incident occurred outside their apartment in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, four days after their wedding. Severiano stole a neighbor's car and was arrested after crashing it during his escape. Police found four handguns, a shotgun, and a bulletproof vest in his car. He has confessed to the murder and is facing life in jail.",

' Sarah Wilson, journalist and author of the best-selling book "I Quit Sugar," discussed her personal struggle with mental illness, including her thoughts of suicide driven by anxiety and feelings of isolation. She also has a thyroid disease and felt left out when comparing herself to others who had husbands and children. Wilson has found some peace with her condition recently and believes that depression and anxiety are linked, with one often leading to the other. She thinks acknowledging this link can help address the increasing rate of Australian women negatively affected by stress and anxiety. Anxiety is becoming the "new depression," with one in three Australian women experiencing anxiety in their lifetime. Beyond Blue and Lifeline are resources for those seeking help.',

' An Oregon woman, Elena Curtin, was charged with second-degree assault after hitting her boyfriend\'s ex-girlfriend with a crowbar in November 2014. The incident occurred when Curtin, who was seven-months pregnant at the time, found the ex-girlfriend using heroin in her bathroom. Prosecutors dropped the charges because Curtin was "completely justified" in her actions as the ex-girlfriend refused to leave her home. Oregon law allows for the use of physical force against an intruder. Curtin\'s ex-boyfriend, the father of her child, had a history of heroin use. The ex-girlfriend and the boyfriend had a five-year-old child together. If Curtin had gone to trial and been convicted, she would have faced a mandatory prison sentence of almost six years.',

' The passage describes a pit bull dog named Gemma who lives with two children. She was filmed in California being fed treats, but her owner tried to trick her by including a broccoli spear. Upon eating the broccoli, Gemma made a face of disgust and spat it out on the floor, suggesting she does not like broccoli. The children she lives with are encouraged to not follow her example and learn to enjoy their greens. The passage also mentions that when not eating, Gemma enjoys sleeping and spending time with her human family.',

" HSBC apologized for a link on its official website that directed visitors to a pornographic page. The link was for the Young Entrepreneur Awards, which were scrapped in 2011 and whose registration was allowed to expire. The porn site took over the address, and the link from HSBC's main website was only removed after the mistake was realized. HSBC is not associated with the external site and has apologized for any inconvenience. The bank emphasized that its website remains secure.",

" A 13-year-old boy, Marcus, from Maryland, called 911 and provided instructions to the dispatcher after his family's home in Clinton caught fire on Sunday morning. Marcus and his 9-year-old sister, Aaliyah, were trapped in a second-floor bedroom due to the heat from the fire on the first floor. During the 11-minute call, Marcus remained calm, soothed his sister, and gave clear directions to the dispatcher. Firefighters from Prince George's County rescued the siblings by entering the room through a broken window. Marcus was handed out first, and the firefighter gave his gas mask to Aaliyah. Both siblings were taken to the hospital with non-life-threatening injuries, along with three other family members who escaped on their own.",

' Blue fluorescent algae, known as Noctiluca scintillans, have been captured in stunning images along Australia\'s east coast, particularly in Jervis Bay and, previously, Manly Beach. This single-celled phytoplankton emits a luminous glow as a defense mechanism against predators. The phenomenon occurs naturally, predominantly in spring and autumn, and is caused by the algae feeding on another type of algae called diatoms. Photographer Andy Hutchinson described the sight as a "beautiful supernatural scene."',

" New tests are available that analyze genetic markers in breast cancer tumors to determine their aggressiveness and the risk of the disease returning. These tests can accurately predict if the risk is as low as 5%, which is comparable to or better than the odds for women who receive chemotherapy. Many breast cancer patients are routinely given chemotherapy after surgery to prevent recurrence, but the side effects can be difficult to endure. The newest test, Endopredict, can help patients make an informed decision about chemotherapy based on their personal risk. These tests are currently available privately for around Â£ 2,500, but there is hope that they will soon be available on the NHS. A low score on the Endopredict test can spare patients from unnecessary chemotherapy.\n\nIn the passage, Becca Cornford's experience is shared as an example. She was diagnosed with breast cancer in both breasts and dreaded chemotherapy more than another mastectomy. After her surgery, a sample of her tumor was sent for testing using the Endopredict test. The low score meant her chances of recurrence within ten years were just 5%, and she was informed that chemotherapy could not offer much better odds. Becca chose to forgo chemotherapy and instead opted for regular monitoring.",

" Over 25 women have been airlifted from Royal Navy ships due to pregnancy in the last nine years, including from ships like HMS Ocean and HMS Illustrious. Eighteen other ships also had emergency evacuations due to pregnancy. A strict 'no touching' rule at sea implies the women likely conceived before boarding the ships or during leave. This news follows the 2014 case of Commander Sarah West, who was relieved of duty following claims of a sexual relationship with a crew member. Women have served on Royal Navy ships since 1990, and in 2014, around 9% of personnel were female. Strict military rules prohibit mothers-to-be from serving in war zones. Similar incidents occurred in Afghanistan and Iraq, where nearly 100 female soldiers were sent home due to pregnancy between 2006 and 2013.",

" A drone with traces of radioactive material, specifically cesium, was found on Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe's residence in Tokyo. The drone, which had a small camera, smoke flares, and a plastic bottle with cesium, is believed to have been equipped with the material intentionally. The discovery has raised concerns about potential terrorism, especially in light of Japan hosting the Olympics and G7 summit, where drones could pose a threat. There are currently no flight restrictions for drones in most of Tokyo, including government buildings. Abe was not in his office at the time, as he was attending the Asian-African conference in Indonesia. The amount of cesium found is not immediately harmful to humans.",

" A security guard in China, Lu Xincai, brings his 84-year-old mother, who has Alzheimer's disease, to work with him every day on the back of his motorbike. He does this because he is afraid she will get lost if left at home alone. They have a close relationship, and Lu ensures his mother's safety by tying a sash around both of their waists during the commute. His employers, a bank, have provided a room for his mother. Lu's wife works in a different city, and his son is still in school, making it impossible for them to look after her. Lu is devoted to caring for his mother, who used to care for him and his siblings when they were young.",

' The passage discusses a study that found an increase in heavy and binge drinking among Americans between 2005 and 2012. Heavy drinking rose by 17.2%, with the majority of the increase coming from women as social norms change. The study is the first to track adult drinking patterns at the county level and found that in 2012, 8% of Americans were heavy drinkers and 18% were binge drinkers. Despite the increase in heavy drinking, the percentage of people who drink any alcohol remained unchanged. The study also notes that alcohol-related deaths and the cost of excessive drinking are high. Public health experts suggest several reasons for the increase in excessive drinking, including changed social norms, increased alcohol advertising, and weakening of alcohol control policies. The study analyzed data from the Behavioral Risk Factor Surveillance System, an ongoing telephone survey of health behaviors conducted by the US Centers for Disease Control.',

" The passage discusses a warning from UN officials that doctors are performing caesarean sections too frequently, which puts the health of women and their babies at risk. The officials state that caesareans should only be carried out when medically necessary, as they can lead to infections, complications, and even death. The rate of caesareans in England has more than doubled since the early 1990s, with a quarter of women now giving birth via caesarean. This includes an increasing number of women who opt for planned caesareans due to anxiety about natural childbirth. The World Health Organization (WHO) recommends that the caesarean rate should ideally be between 10% and 15% due to the risks and costs involved. A planned caesarean costs the NHS Â£2,369, compared to Â£1,665 for a natural birth. The WHO's statement contradicts current NHS guidelines, which offer the procedure to women even when there is no medical justification. The WHO states that doctors are carrying out caesareans too often and underestimating the risks, with previous research finding that as many as one in ten caesareans can cause infections.",

" A woman, Michelle Filkins, was arrested for breaking and entering, larceny over $250, and malicious destruction of property after allegedly living in a home on Martha's Vineyard for at least a week and selling the owners' items in a yard sale. Filkins was discovered in the home by owner Mark Conklin on April 17 and was arrested several hours later after attempting to re-enter the home. Items missing from the home include furniture, lamps, pots, pans, linens, and a painting by the owner. The police are asking for the return of any stolen items and are investigating the incident.",

" An unlocked iPhone belonging to Bella Crooke from Melbourne was found at a police station in Albury, on the border of NSW and Victoria. Unable to locate the owner, police officers posted selfies and humorous comments on Bella's Facebook page, which had been linked to her phone. Bella recovered her phone later that day, appreciating the officers' sense of humor and acknowledging the importance of password-protecting her device. The police were commended by Bella and her friends for their creative and effective approach in reuniting her with her lost phone.",

" A five-day-old baby hippo was killed in a fight between two adult hippos at the Isimangaliso Wetland Park in Eastern South Africa. The calf's mother was present but did not intervene, possibly to avoid danger. A tour operator, Stacey Farrell, witnessed the incident and described the calf being thrown into the air by one of the fighting adults. The calf died from its injuries a few hours later. The cause of the fight and the intent of the adult hippo are unclear.",

" A three-bedroom apartment in Knightsbridge, London, is for sale at Â£575,000, which is significantly lower than neighboring properties but has only three years left on the lease. The cost for the three-year lease would be around Â£15,000 per month. However, if a buyer decides to extend the lease, the property could be worth up to Â£6 million. The unmodernized maisonette, located in exclusive Egerton Place, is described as bright and well-proportioned, with 1,990 sq/ft of space, three bedrooms, two bathrooms, a reception room, a utility room, a lift, parking, and a communal garden. The property is being sold by Russell Simpson. If modernized, the property could sell for between Â£2,750 and Â£3,000 per sq/ft, giving it a Â£6 million price tag. The current freeholder is thought to be the Welcome Trust, and any buyer would have to negotiate a lease extension with them, which could cost between Â£3.35 and Â£4.5 million for a 90-year lease. The property's first occupant was Sir Evan MacGregor, Permanent Secretary to the Admiralty, and other residents included the Dowager Lady Lawrence and Sir Henry Fielding Dickens, Q.C. It is rare for properties with such short leases to come on the market in this area, and potential buyers are warned about the high cost of extending the lease.",

' Starbucks experienced a computer outage affecting 8,000 stores in the US and Canada, causing registers to malfunction and prompting baristas to give away free drinks. The outage, which began in the evening on the East Coast and late afternoon on the West Coast, was due to a failure during a daily system refresh. Stores are expected to open as usual on Saturday. Some stores closed early during the outage, while others continued to serve customers, accepting cash only. The incident occurred after Starbucks posted record quarterly earnings the previous day.',

' Terrorists are being trained in rural areas of West Wales, specifically in Ceredigion, Powys, and Pembrokeshire, according to an officer from the Wales Extremism and Counter Terrorism Unit. These locations have been used to radicalize Muslims, with individuals often participating in ordinary activities in the community with an ulterior motive. This issue is not confined to large cities, as evidenced by incidents of Islamic extremist activity in Wales dating back to 1998. The rugged terrain of these areas, which is also used for British military training, has been utilized for this purpose. Several individuals have been arrested and convicted in connection to terrorism-related activities in Wales, including Michael Adebowale, who studied Arabic at the European Institute of Human Sciences in Highmead, near Llanybydder. Community intelligence is crucial in identifying and preventing such activities.',

" A previously thought to be extinct Omura's whale was found on a beach in Exmouth, Western Australia, after Tropical Cyclone Olwyn hit the area. This is the first sighting of the species in Western Australia and the second in Australia. The 5.68m juvenile female was difficult to identify, but DNA profiling confirmed its species. The Omura's whale was only described in scientific journals in 2003 and is usually found in tropical and subtropical waters such as Indonesian waters, the Philippines, and the Sea of Japan. The whale has a sleek body shape and unique skeletal features, including 53 vertebrae. Authorities have buried the carcass, and the skeleton will be recovered in a few years for further scientific investigation and potential public display in museums.",

" The passage discusses the role of hormones in presidential politics, focusing on the idea that a female candidate's hormones could impact her decision-making. The primary example given is Hillary Clinton, with commentary on how her hormones might make her irrational and lead to unnecessary wars. The passage also counters this argument by citing studies that show women leaders take fewer unnecessary risks than men.

The text further explores the bias against women in the workplace, providing examples of gender stereotypes and the impact they have on women's careers. It highlights the underrepresentation of women in corporate boards and the different ways bias manifests itself overtly and covertly.

The author emphasizes that Hillary Clinton's potential challenges in reaching the White House are not unique to Democrats, but are a concern for everyone. The text concludes by stating that equality benefits everyone and encourages a change in mindset towards women in leadership roles.

In summary, the passage discusses the controversy surrounding hormones in presidential politics, primarily focusing on Hillary Clinton, and sheds light on the gender bias that continues to impact women's careers.",

' Veteran actor Robert Hardy, known for his roles in All Creatures Great and Small and as Winston Churchill in several television dramas, is selling his collection of antiques in a Â£100,000 auction. The 89-year-old actor, who is a military historian and expert on the medieval longbow, is downsizing his home and parting with over 200 items he has collected over his career. The collection includes a diorama of the Battle of Agincourt, a pair of Victorian cabinets, a portrait of Hardy holding a longbow, a longbow made from yew, paintings, furniture, swords, flintlock rifles, silverware, crystal chandeliers, and dozens of books dating back to the 17th century. The auction, which will take place on Saturday, is being held by Dominic Winter Auctioneers in Gloucestershire and includes a total of 238 lots. Hardy said he was sad to sell his collection but entrusting it to the auction house has taken away some of the pain. He has built up his collection thanks to his interest in classic literature and military history, and has published two books on the history of the longbow. He was also consulted as an expert during the raising of the Tudor shipwreck the Mary Rose. Hardy was forced to retire from stage acting two years ago but has insisted that he will continue to do television work despite his advanced age.',

" Michael Scott Shemansky, a Florida man, is wanted for the murder of his mother, Sandra Shemansky, who was found dead in the home they shared in Winter Garden. Authorities have been searching for him since Saturday after he failed to appear for a supervised visit with his son and his mother's body was discovered during a well-being check. Shemansky has a history of bipolar mental illness, battery on law enforcement, and was involuntarily committed to a psychiatric ward for an attempted suicide. Neighbors believe that his mother's efforts to help him during a divorce and the stress of the proceedings may have triggered his alleged actions. The murder weapon has been recovered, but the cause of death has not been disclosed. Shemansky was last seen fleeing on foot without medication and his estranged wife is preparing for his potential arrival at her home. Anyone with information on his whereabouts is urged to contact authorities.",

" The International Association of Athletics Federations (IAAF) has awarded the 2021 World Championships to Eugene, United States. This decision was made by the IAAF Council as a strategic opportunity to host the championships in the USA for the first time, despite Eugene's failure to secure the 2019 event. The IAAF was persuaded by a recent presentation that the city has the capability to host the World Championships. Previously, the 2007 World Championships in Osaka, Japan were also awarded without a bidding process. IAAF President Lamine Diack expressed his delight in the decision, highlighting the opportunity to access a key market and support the global development of the sport.",

" Leonie Granger, a 25-year-old aspiring model and care assistant, lured professional gambler Mehmet Hassan to his death in a honey trap to steal his winnings. Granger, from Gillingham, Kent, befriended Hassan after spotting him at a casino in London's West End, taking advantage of him being a 'soft target'. She introduced Hassan to her boyfriend, Kyrron Jackson, and his accomplice, Nicholas Chandler. After going back to Hassan's flat one night, Granger left the door unlocked so Jackson and Chandler could tie him up, kick him to death, and ransack his home. Granger was found guilty of manslaughter and sentenced to 16 years in prison. Jackson and Chandler were found guilty of murder and sentenced to life in prison with a minimum term of 36 years. The attack was described as 'pitiless and wicked'.",

" Chelsea midfielder Cesc Fabregas has been struggling with his form in the second half of the season, both for his club and country. He received poor ratings for his performance in Spain's 2-0 defeat by Holland. Earlier in the season, Fabregas was in excellent form and looked set to break the Premier League record for assists. However, his form has significantly dipped since then, with only one assist in five games he has played since mid-January. This drop in form has been noted in the past, as his former club Barcelona released a statement about his traditional post-Christmas slump. Despite this, Chelsea manager Jose Mourinho will be looking for Fabregas to find form again in the remaining nine games of the Premier League season, as the team could need as many as six wins to secure the title.",

" West Ham United is in discussions to sign Jamaican forward Deshane Beckford, who has impressed coaches during a two-week trial with the club's academy. Beckford, a 17-year-old starlet from Montego Bay United, has also received offers from clubs in Belgium and is considered one of the top prospects to emerge from the Caribbean. West Ham is using a pricing strategy to offer season tickets at the Olympic Stadium for as little as Â£289, making it the cheapest in the Barclays Premier League, in an effort to fill the 54,000-capacity stadium when the team moves there for the 2016-17 season.",

" The police have stopped investigating a vicious assault on Mike Lane, joint master of the Tedworth Hunt, which occurred three months ago, despite substantial evidence including a video, a dossier of evidence with saboteurs' names and car registration numbers, and a clear video image of the attacker. Lane was beaten by balaclava-clad protesters with iron bars on ropes while chasing an artificial scent, resulting in hospitalization for concussion, broken teeth, facial swelling, and memory loss. Wiltshire police have not identified, charged, or prosecuted anyone involved, causing disappointment and mistrust among hunt supporters. Lane and other witnesses provided statements to the police, but the investigation has been halted due to insufficient evidence. This decision has been met with criticism from Lane, witnesses, and the Countryside Alliance, who are campaigning to ban face coverings for saboteurs to facilitate the prosecution of criminals. Wiltshire police have stated that the case is currently undetected and may be reopened if further evidence emerges.",

" Adam Gadahn, also known as Azzam the American, was an American-born operative for Al Qaeda who was killed in a U.S. government counterterrorism operation in January. He was not specifically targeted in the operation. Gadahn, 36, was a prominent member of Al Qaeda, known for his many statements on behalf of the organization. He was born in 1978 and grew up on a farm in rural California. He converted to Islam in 1995 and moved to Pakistan in 1998. Gadahn was tasked with being the English-language propagandist for Al Qaeda and appeared in several of their videos, threatening attacks on American, Western, and Jewish interests. He was indicted for treason and material support to Al Qaeda in 2006 and was among the FBI's most wanted terrorists. Gadahn was married to a Muslim woman from Afghanistan and had at least one child. He last contacted his family in 2002. He was killed in the same operation as another American citizen and Al Qaeda operative, Ahmed Farouq, and two hostages, Warren Weinstein and Giovanni Lo Porto.",

" A five-year-old Chinese boy named Mai Zizhuo has become an internet sensation in China after a video showcasing his impressive basketball skills went viral. Mai has been practicing basketball since he was two and a half years old, and his skills include scoring a series of hoops and dribbling two basketballs simultaneously while maintaining rhythm. His talents have won him a large fanbase across China, with many praising his abilities and some expressing disbelief and even feeling ashamed of their own skills in comparison. The video has sparked numerous comments and discussions online, with viewers expressing their admiration and astonishment at Mai's potential.",

' Tom O\'Carroll, a former member of the Paedophile Information Exchange (PIE) which advocated for the legalization of child sex in the 1970s and 80s, has become a supporter of the media pressure group Hacked Off. O\'Carroll, who was an information officer at the Open University and a key activist for PIE, attended a Hacked Off rally at the Houses of Parliament on February 25 to lobby MPs for state involvement in media regulation. Hacked Off was set up following the phone-hacking scandal and is campaigning for a statutory body to regulate the press, as recommended by the Leveson Inquiry. PIE, formed in 1974, also campaigned for lowering the age of sexual consent and legalizing incest. O\'Carroll was jailed in 1981 for "corrupting public morals" and attended the Hacked Off rally chaired by John Cleese. Hacked Off has stated that the meeting was open to the public.',

' On Thursday, the Bondi Icebergs Club pool was drained for a fashion show as part of Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week Australia. The pool served as an unusual catwalk for the Ten Pieces presentation, a unisex clothing label headed by Maurice Terzini and Lucy Hinckfuss. The collection, named "Mono," consisted of ten pieces designed to be worn in 20 different ways, suitable for day-to-night wear. The minimalist, androgynous designs were showcased with models walking through the empty pool and along the break wall, with beachgoers and passers-by stopping to watch. Guests enjoyed the sunny weather and unseasonably warm temperatures while taking in the show, which featured scarves and hoodies from the collection. Nibbles by Icebergs and drinks from Santa Vittoria were served.',

' Amir Khan, a boxer from Bolton, visited a safari park in Northern California with his family, including his wife Faryal Makhdoom Khan and daughter Lamysa. They enjoyed their time off by posing with and feeding various animals such as a rare white tiger, giraffes, and sea lions. Recently, Khan announced that he will fight former light-welterweight world champion Chris Algieri on May 30, ending speculation about his next opponent. Previously, there was increasing pressure on Khan to face British rival and IBF welterweight champion Kell Brook in June. However, Khan stated that he was already in negotiations to fight someone else.',

' Mohammed Abu Khdeir, a Palestinian teenager beaten and burned alive by three Israelis, was briefly included on an Israeli memorial commemorating soldiers and terror victims at Jerusalem\'s Mount Herzl. His family and an organization for victims of terror in Israel, Almagor, objected to his inclusion, calling it a "trick" and demanding his name be removed. Almagor described Abu Khdeir\'s death as a "rogue attack" and not an act of terror. The National Insurance Institute of Israel, which maintains the memorial site, decided to remove Abu Khdeir\'s name following his father\'s complaints. The teenager\'s name has been taken down from the organization\'s website and is expected to be removed from the memorial wall. A panel is hearing evidence against the three suspects in Abu Khdeir\'s killing.',

' A YouTube user named Lionel Hutz filmed his young son trying to use their family cat as a pillow in their garden. The son chases the cat around and plonks himself on top of it, but the cat is not amused and scurries away to another spot. This sequence repeats a few times before the cat goes inside. Later, the cat and boy are seen making up, with the boy gently feeding the cat treats.',

" Robert Kushner, a 32-year-old witness in a police corruption trial in Philadelphia, has been removed from his coaching job at the Jack M. Barrack Hebrew Academy after testifying about his past as a marijuana dealer. Kushner had previously passed a background check when hired in 2010, but school officials were unaware of his 2007 arrest and expunged charges. Kushner also admitted to being arrested again in 2011 and sentenced to four years of probation, as well as pleading guilty to driving under the influence in 2008. The school's head, Sharon Levin, stated that Kushner had deceived them, but Kushner claims he never meant to and is innocent of the 2011 charges. Kushner also coaches in a Narberth summer league, where he is described as an excellent coach who is good with kids. The defense lawyers for the six former drug squad officers accused of racketeering have claimed that the government's case is based on the testimonies of 19 lying drug dealers and a rogue ex-cop.",

' Six people were injured in an explosion at a chemical plant in Zhangzhou city, Fujian province, China. The plant, which produces paraxylene (PX), a carcinogenic chemical used in polyester films and fabrics, had a blast at an oil storage facility due to an oil leak. Although the fire has been contained, residents nearby reported hearing the explosion and feeling slight tremors. The plant was previously in Xiamen but was moved due to protests over pollution concerns. No toxic chemical spill has been reported in this incident.',

" Jack Grealish, an 18-year-old midfielder for Aston Villa, made his first Premier League start in a 3-3 draw against QPR. Grealish is known for wearing his socks low, covering children's-sized shinpads, as a superstition, and he plans to continue this practice despite being told by referees to pull his socks up. Grealish has faith in this superstition, as he has not been kicked on the shin yet. He views his first start as an opportunity to earn more playing time for the rest of the season.",

" Bobbi Kristina Brown, daughter of Bobby Brown and Whitney Houston, suffered global and irreversible brain damage and remains unresponsive, according to her grandmother Cissy Houston. Brown is no longer in a medically induced coma but remains unaware of her surroundings and has a tracheostomy. Bobby Brown previously stated his daughter's condition had improved, but Cissy Houston and a source close to the family have reported that Brown's neurological state has not changed. Brown is undergoing rehabilitation, and her future quality of life is uncertain.",

" Russia is close to reaching the Fed Cup final with a 2-0 lead against Germany, after Anastasia Pavlyuchenkova won a tight match against Sabine Lisicki and Svetlana Kuznetsova defeated Julia Goerges. Pavlyuchenkova saved a match point and won the match despite her 13 double faults, while Lisicki's 63 unforced errors proved costly. Russia needs one more win from the remaining three matches on Sunday to secure their spot in the final and win their first Fed Cup title since 2008.",

' Residents of New South Wales (NSW), Australia are being warned to prepare for more floods and damage as another storm is predicted to hit the region later in the week. The storm is expected to be an east coast low, the same weather system that caused three days of wild weather in the state last week. The State Emergency Service (SES) is concerned that more storms will hamper clean-up efforts, as they still have over 4,000 jobs from the 24,196 requests for assistance during the last storm. The SES is particularly worried about the effect more wild weather will have on the hard-hit Hunter region. Meteorologists predict heavy rain from Thursday to Saturday, mainly in the northern parts of the state and along the coast. The SES is urging residents to prepare themselves, their homes, and their families to prevent further loss and devastation. The Bureau of Meteorology is monitoring the situation, but it is too early to tell how severe the weather system will be. The SES has over 1000 personnel in the field across NSW, including 200 from other states.',

' Nina Moric, a 38-year-old model who appeared in Ricky Martin\'s music video for "La Vida Loca," denied attempting to take her own life. She claimed to have been hospitalized after a fall at home due to low blood pressure. Moric posted pictures of her bruises on Instagram and reassured her fans that she was recovering. Italian media reported that she tried to commit suicide and had a history of attempting suicide in 2009. Moric was once married to famous paparazzi snapper Fabrizio Corona, with whom she has a son, Carlos Maria. Corona was jailed for blackmailing celebrities with compromising photographs.',

" Kate and William, the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge, are expecting their second child, and the British public is hoping for a traditional name, particularly if it's a girl. According to a YouGov survey for The Sunday Times, Diana is the top choice for a girl, with 12% of the votes, followed by Alice and Charlotte with 9% each. If the child is a boy, James and Alexander are the top picks. Many Brits are hoping for a baby princess, and if the baby is named Diana, 14% of those polled would be more emotional. The public also supports William taking six weeks of paternity leave from his pilot job. This sentiment is echoed on social media, with users expressing their desire for the baby to be named Diana, after William's mother, Princess Diana.",

' On Thursday, a suicide bomber detonated explosives near a group of protesters in Khost, Eastern Afghanistan, killing 17 people and injuring 64, including an Afghan lawmaker. The protesters, led by Humayoon Humayoon, an Afghan member of parliament for Khost province, were heading to a larger rally against the provincial governor. The Taliban has denied involvement, and no other group has claimed responsibility. The attack occurred around 10 a.m. local time.',

' Dani Alves, the Brazilian right-back for Barcelona, is likely to leave the club this summer after rejecting their final contract offer. His representative, Dinorah Santana, confirmed that negotiations have ended as Alves declined a three-year contract extension that required him to participate in 60% of matches. Alves has spent seven successful years at Barcelona, winning four Spanish titles and two Champions League titles. The club did not renew his contract in a timely manner, leading to his departure.',

' Pablo Osvaldo, a 29-year-old football player for Argentinian club Boca Juniors on loan from Southampton, has expressed his desire for Italian legends Andrea Pirlo and Francesco Totti to join him at Boca Juniors. Osvaldo believes that Pirlo and Totti would be a good fit for the club and that Boca Juniors\' fans would be excited to see them play at the Bombonera stadium. He considers both players to have a "South-American style" and believes they would be popular among fans. Pirlo is known for being one of the best midfielders in the world and Totti, who is a Roma legend, is also highly regarded.',

' Eighteen-year-old amateur jockey Lewis Ferguson fell from his horse, Merrion Square, during a race at Wincanton, resulting in a spectcular double somersault fall. The incident has been widely viewed online. Despite the fall, Ferguson suffered only a minor cut on his nose and has no serious injuries. He resumed riding the next day and is determined to continue racing. Ferguson described the fall as a "blur" and something he couldn\'t avoid. He received good-natured teasing from other jockeys and gained several hundred Twitter followers. Ferguson has a lighthearted attitude about the incident and jokingly considered a career in gymnastics. No special treatment was given to Ferguson at Paul Nicholls\' yard the morning after the fall.',

' James Haskell, captain of the London Wasps rugby team, posted an Instagram photo of himself dressed as Iron Man in anticipation of the new Avengers: Age of Ultron movie. Haskell started his career with Wasps in 2002, playing eight seasons and earning his first England cap. He then moved to Stade Francais in France for two seasons, followed by stints with Ricoh Black Rams in Japan and Highlanders in New Zealand. He returned to Wasps in 2012, where he has since surpassed 100 appearances and become a key member of the England squad with 57 caps. The Avengers: Age of Ultron movie premiered at Westfield London shopping center, with Haskell joining fans in anticipation of the film.',

" The passage discusses the wide-leg trouser trend for SS15, which is a shift from the skinny jean trend that has been popular for several years. The wide-leg trouser can be worn in various styles, including denim, cropped, printed, and striped. High heels and simple tops are recommended to balance the voluminous bottoms. Denim wide-leg trousers are an easy way to try the trend, as seen on the Gucci SS15 runway and Topshop's Miller jean. Celine and Stella McCartney showcased dressier styles, suitable for evening looks. Online label Finery London offers similar styles at a lower price point. Celebrities like Poppy Delevingne have been seen wearing the trend. Wide-leg trousers are a silhouette that can update one's wardrobe and is not dependent on good weather.",

' The University of Michigan decided to show the film "American Sniper" despite objections from some students who had signed a petition against it. The students were concerned about the film\'s negative depiction of the Middle East and its people. The university\'s decision to cancel the movie was reversed after a backlash and a counter-petition. The university\'s vice president for student life, E. Royster Harper, stated that the initial decision to cancel the movie was a mistake and not in line with the university\'s values of freedom of expression. The university will also offer a screening of "Paddington" for those who prefer not to attend "American Sniper". The decision was praised by Michigan head football coach Jim Harbaugh. The university\'s location in Detroit metropolitan area is home to the nation\'s largest Arab-American population. The film "American Sniper" is about Chris Kyle, a navy seal and the most lethal sniper in US military history, played by Bradley Cooper who was nominated for an oscar for his role. Kyle was fatally shot in a Texas shooting range in 2013.',

' Two French tourists attempted a cruel act of setting a quokka on fire with an aerosol spray and a lighter on Rottnest Island, Western Australia on April 3. The quokka survived but was singed. The men, aged 18 and 24 and living in Cockburn Central, were charged with animal cruelty and evicted from the island. Video evidence was seized. The quokka is a small animal, similar in size to a domestic cat, found on some islands off the coast of Western Australia, including Rottnest and Bald Island near Albany.',

' The passage describes 102-year-old Alice Barker, a former dancer in New York nightspots like the Cotton Club and Cafe Zanzibar in the 1930s and 1940s. She danced alongside notable figures such as Bill "Bojangles" Robinson and Frank Sinatra. Despite motion pictures being taken of Barker, she had never seen any of them, and had lost all her photographs and memorabilia over the years. However, Mark Cantor of Jazz-on-Film.com and some volunteers created a video of "soundies," or early music videos, and showed them to Barker at her nursing home. She was delighted to see herself dancing again after all those years.',

" The practice of washing one's own car is declining in Britain, with a third of men and three-quarters of women admitting they have never washed their own car. The rise of hand car washes and increased convenience (such as shops being open on Sundays and more live football on TV) are contributing to this decline. Only 12% of men who do wash their own cars do it regularly. The tradition of having children wash cars for extra pocket money is also dying out. However, more people wash their cars during holidays, although some do it as an excuse to get out of the house. Cars are most likely to be washed by their owners in Birmingham, Chelmsford, and Sheffield, and least likely in Oxford, Bath, and Edinburgh. Audi, Toyota, and BMW owners are most likely to wash their own cars, while Range Rover, Peugeot, and Mercedes owners are least likely. Time constraints and the availability of automated car washes and cheap labor are cited as reasons for the decline of this tradition.",

' Martin Skrtel has praised the impact and leadership of Steven Gerrard, who is set to end his Liverpool career after the FA Cup final on May 30. Skrtel revealed that Gerrard helped him settle at Liverpool when he joined in 2008. Although Skrtel acknowledges that Liverpool will be different without Gerrard, he believes the club has potential replacements for the iconic midfielder. Both Gerrard and Skrtel could return to the Liverpool line-up for the FA Cup semi-final against Aston Villa after serving three-match bans.',

' Jack Nicklaus, age 75, made a hole-in-one at the Par-3 Contest at Augusta National during the Masters Week. This was his first hole-in-one at Augusta, but was later overshadowed by Camilo Villegas who also made two hole-in-ones on the fourth and eighth holes. Villegas couldn\'t win the title, which was won by Kevin Streelman. Nicklaus, known as the "Golden Bear," is a legendary golfer who has won the green jacket twice and is one of five men to complete a career grand slam.',

' On Wednesday night, tornado sirens sounded in Kansas due to multiple storms that brought reports of twisters. A tornado was spotted 6 miles northwest of Goddard, moving northeast and missing Wichita but potentially posing risks to other communities. Other tornado sightings occurred in southwestern Kansas, with three near Aetna, and possibly in Potosi, Missouri. The storms also brought reports of wind damage, flooding, and baseball-sized hail in the affected areas. More storms are expected in the Midwest, Mississippi River Valley, Tennessee River Valley, and near the Southern Great Lakes on Thursday.',

" Robert Bates, a 73-year-old reserve deputy for the Tulsa County Sheriff's Office, pleaded not guilty to a manslaughter charge after fatally shooting Eric Harris during a weapons sting operation in April. Bates claims the shooting was accidental, as he intended to use a taser instead of his gun. The Harris family's lawyer alleges that Bates was not qualified for the position and received preferential treatment due to his friendship with the sheriff and donations to the agency. The family expressed disappointment in Bates' decision to vacation in the Bahamas before his preliminary hearing on July 2. The sheriff's office has denied allegations of forged records and two deputies involved in the arrest have been reassigned due to threats. Bates' lawyers released most of his training records, claiming they prove his proper law enforcement training. CNN's Jason Morris and Ed Lavandera contributed to this report.",

" Conor McGregor, a 26-year-old Irish featherweight fighter, is set to challenge Jose Aldo for the featherweight title on July 11 in Las Vegas. This will be Aldo's eighth title defense. McGregor has recently unveiled a new tattoo of a tiger on his stomach, stating that if his opponents see it, it's too late. The two fighters have a strained relationship, with McGregor claiming that Aldo lacks motivation to defend his title compared to McGregor's desire to win it. During a promotional tour in Dublin, McGregor grabbed Aldo's belt and raised it in front of 5,000 home supporters, further fueling their rivalry.",

" In the passage, former Australian Prime Minister Tony Abbott is criticized for 'skolling' a beer at an Australian Rules function, which was seen as promoting binge drinking and associating masculinity with heavy drinking. Anti-drinking campaigners and a cultural studies professor argue that this action sets a poor example and perpetuates harmful stereotypes. Health Minister Sussan Ley defended Abbott, emphasizing his fitness and hard work. The passage also mentions that heavy drinking has been historically linked to Australian culture, but recent concerns over binge drinking should be taken into account. Former Labor Prime Minister Bob Hawke is also mentioned as another politician who has shown off his skolling skills.",

' Indiana has seen a significant increase in HIV cases in Scott County, with 120 confirmed and 10 preliminary positive cases, up from 106 the previous week. This outbreak is primarily due to the use of the high-powered painkiller Opana among intravenous drug users. A short-term needle exchange program was approved by Governor Mike Pence on March 26, which has provided 5,322 clean syringes to 86 participants. However, the future of this program and the legislation that would allow similar programs in other counties is uncertain, as Pence opposes needle exchanges as an anti-drug policy. The legislature has until April 29 to consider a final version of the bill. Medical funding and sustainability of the program are also concerns.',

" A passionate Arsenal fan gave his girlfriend, Saskia, a quiz about the football club to test her knowledge. She scored 87% (43.5/50) and avoided being dumped. Saskia's boyfriend shared Arsenal trivia questions, player position facts, and even graded her with comments for improvement. The quiz included questions about the starting 11 squad, top goal scorers, 2014 FA Cup final details, and a comparison between Alexis Sanchez and Eden Hazard. Saskia's performance was shared on Twitter, receiving mixed reactions from users, with some praising the boyfriend as a 'legend' and others criticizing him for taking the quiz too far. Overall, the passage highlights the unique way this Arsenal fan decided to test his girlfriend's devotion and knowledge about the club.",

' Carlos Toro, a former mid-level member of the Medellin cartel who became an undercover operative for the DEA after fleeing Colombia in the 1980s, faces deportation after 27 years of service. Toro, who helped take down drug lord Carlos Lehder Rivas and aided in the prosecution of former Panamanian dictator Manuel Noriega, was told he would be rewarded with US citizenship. However, he was never granted citizenship and is now living in the US illegally due to declining health. The DEA refused to help Toro with his citizenship after he went public with his situation. Toro is currently trying to obtain a green card or passport and cannot collect social security benefits until he secures one of those documents. His final temporary visa expired on January 1, and he is prepared to go into hiding if necessary.',

' A 14-year-old girl in India set herself on fire after being gang-raped by five men from her village and being told to keep quiet about the attack by her family. She is currently in the hospital with severe burns. The accused men have been arrested. This incident has brought attention to the issue of sexual assault in India, where there has been heightened sensitivity due to recent attacks and protests calling for more protection for women. The documentary "India\'s Daughter" about a previous gang rape and murder of a student in Delhi has been banned, causing controversy and incidents of vigilante justice.',

' Manchester United manager Louis van Gaal will face Manchester City in the derby at Old Trafford without Robin van Persie, who is not yet fit according to the manager. Van Gaal aims to win the match to finish as high as second or third in the league, avoiding a Champions League qualifying fixture. City recently lost to Crystal Palace, providing an opportunity for United. Van Gaal emphasized the importance of controlling aggression in the match, having lost the previous encounter 1-0. Luke Shaw is also not fit to play. Van Gaal looks forward to the Old Trafford atmosphere, appreciating the support from United fans.',

' Arsenal and Liverpool fans left empty seats at the Emirates Stadium for the first 10 minutes of their Premier League match to protest against rising ticket prices. The protest was in response to the Premier League\'s Â£5.14 billion TV rights deal and the cheapest tickets for the match being Â£64. Fans hope the empty seats will raise awareness of the struggle to meet the rising costs of following their clubs. Protesters, including the Black Scarf Movement, Spirit of Shankly, and Spion Kop 1906 fan groups, called ticket prices "extortionate" and demanded tangible reductions in line with what working-class people earn. Further protests were expected after the match.',

" A newborn baby, Star Reader, had a life-thing liver condition called biliary atresia and underwent a transplant from her mother's twin sister, Shanell Reader. Star's parents, Jade Reader and Matthew Bygrave, noticed her skin turning yellowish shortly after birth, which led to the discovery of the blocked bile ducts. Doctors attempted to unclog them, but a liver transplant was the only option left. Star's parents were not suitable matches, but her twin aunt, Shanell, turned out to be an ideal candidate. The transplant was successful, and Star is now recovering well, with regular blood tests and liver function tests, and will require anti-rejection medication for life. Shanell, who also made a full recovery, did not hesitate to donate a part of her liver to save her niece.",

" Chelsea football players Eden Hazard, Nathan Ake, Loic Remy, and Willian participated in Audi's football challenge. The challenges included:

1. Firing balls into the boot of a car from close range. Hazard and Ake won this round 5-3.
2. Sinking balls into convertible Audis from long range. Hazard and Ake won this round as well.
3. Playing tennis over an Audi R8 V10 Plus. Hazard and Ake won this round, taking a 6-0 lead.
4. Shooting from long range to sink footballs through the top of a convertible Audi. Remy and Willian won this round.

In the final challenge, Willian accidentally smashed the wing mirror of one of the Audis with a long-range shot, causing Remy to put his hands on his head in shock. However, it is unlikely that Remy will have to pay for the damage. The video ends with Willian laughing while driving one of the Audis.",

" Robert Dellinger, a former Fortune 500 executive from New Hampshire, claimed at his sentencing on Wednesday that he was not suicidal on the day he crashed into a couple's SUV, killing them and their unborn child. Dellinger had previously stated to investigators that he was trying to kill himself when he drove his truck across a median at over 100mph and collided with the SUV. The couple, Amanda Murphy and Jason Timmons, both 29, were killed instantly in the crash on December 7, 2013. Dellinger pleaded guilty in February to negligent homicide and one count of assault for the fetus's death. He faces 12 to 24 years in prison when sentencing resumes on Thursday. Dellinger's lawyers claim that he was suffering from multiple sclerosis, ambien withdrawal, and the effects of a psychiatric drug overdose at the time of the crash. He had previously held high-level positions at PPG Industries Inc., Sprint Corp., Delphi Corp., and General Electric Co. Dellinger's wife, Deborah, described him as a man of ethics, integrity, and friendship who has lived his life with grace and modesty, despite being plagued with serious health problems. Dellinger's attorneys have also stated that he was suffering from the advanced symptoms of multiple sclerosis at the time of the crash.",

" A man, Chris Hill, expressed his hope that his ex-wife, Lacey Spears, would die in prison after she was sentenced to 20 years to life for murdering their 5-year-old son, Garnett-Paul Spears, by poisoning him with salt. Garnett suffered through repeated hospitalizations, medical procedures, and ultimately poisoning throughout his life, all at the hands of his mother. Lacey Spears was spared the maximum sentence of 25 years to life, showing no emotion during her sentencing. Her lawyer plans to appeal the verdict, while prosecutors blame Spears for her son's short and tormented life. Spears' ex-husband, Chris Hill, expressed his anger on Facebook, stating that she deserves to be beaten to death in prison due to her lack of emotion during her sentencing.",

' Two new strains of influenza, H3N2 and B/Phuket, caused a spike in deaths in Europe and the United States during the northern winter. The vaccine used in the northern hemisphere was not effective against these strains, prompting the modification of the vaccine for use in Australia. The new vaccine, which also protects against H1N1, will be available from April 20 for high-risk groups, and is worth the wait. Dr. Alan Hampson, chair of the Influenza Specialist Group, encourages everyone to get the vaccine and to book their appointments now, as stocks are arriving a month later than expected. The modified vaccine will also be used in the next northern winter.',

' The caretakers of Abraham Lincoln\'s tomb in Springfield, Illinois are concerned about budget cuts and an unfavorable critique in National Geographic Magazine. The magazine described the tomb as having "all the historical character of an office lobby," which the caretakers disagree with. The tomb, designed by sculptor Larkin Mead, was dedicated by President Ulysses S. Grant in 1874 and has undergone recent repairs and renovations, leaving it in excellent physical condition. However, the State of Illinois is facing a financial crisis and the Governor, Bruce Rauner, has proposed eliminating the state historic preservation agency that manages the tomb, which could lead to further reductions in staff and hours of operation. This proposed change has caused concern among those who support the current presentation of Lincoln\'s final resting place.',

" The nineties and early noughties fashion trends are becoming popular again, including chokers, berry-colored lips, round sunglasses, and Calvin Klein logo t-shirts. However, the return of JNCO's wide-leg jeans has been met with criticism from those who wore them the first time around. Other questionable trends making a comeback include the bucket hat, camouflage print, taking trends to the extreme, Ugg boots, Daisy Dukes, Juicy Couture tracksuits, colored sunglasses, corsets as outfits, and harem pants. Celebrities such as Rihanna, Jourdan Dunn, Kylie Jenner, and Kristen Bell have been seen wearing these trends.",

' Four rainbows were seen in the sky over the New York area after a heavy rainfall. A photo of this phenomenon was taken by Amanda Curtis, CEO of a fashion company. In rural China, hiring exotic dancers for wakes has been a common practice, but this is now being cracked down on by the government. Actor Robert Downey Jr. showed agitation during a Channel 4 interview when asked about his private life. The Kardashians are once again a trending topic due to their influence on lip plumping, which has inspired the #kyliejennerchallenge. A prom proposal that referenced bombs was not allowed by one school, with the proposer accusing the administrators of racism. Ewan McGregor is set to play Lumiere in the upcoming "Beauty and the Beast" film, and a trailer for "Black Mass" shows Johnny Depp in a nearly unrecognizable appearance. A pregnant woman announced her pregnancy by referencing "The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air," and a military father photobombed his son\'s photo, receiving recognition for his originality.',

" The Miami Open has seen two tennis players, Serena Williams and Andy Murray, receive large cakes in celebration of their recent milestone victories - 700 for Williams and 500 for Murray. Williams, currently ranked world No. 1, defeated Sabine Lisicki to progress to the semi-finals, where she will face Simona Halep. Williams' hopes of facing her sister Venus in the semi-finals were dashed when Venus lost to Carla Suarez Navarro. The passage also mentions a tight match between Williams and Lisicki, and Halep's victory over Sloane Stephens to reach the semi-finals.",

" Sabeen Mahmud, a Pakistani cafe owner and human rights activist, was shot and killed in Karachi. She was known for hosting discussions on topics such as women's entrepreneurship and free speech, and had recently led a discussion on the issue of people disappearing in Baluchistan province. Mahmud had received death threats in the past due to her activism. She was shot at point-blank range outside of her second floor cafe, which was a popular gathering place for those seeking secular wisdom and freedom of thought. Mahmud was a strong advocate for humanism, love, and tolerance, and was considered a figurehead for these values in Pakistan. No one has claimed responsibility for her shooting and the police have not named a motive.",

" Mangu Ram, an 82-year-old Hindu healer, has been living in Indian Kashmir as a refugee for 70 years after fleeing from Pakistan during the partition of India. He, along with thousands of other West Pakistan Refugees (WPRs), have been denied citizenship rights, including the right to own property or vote in state elections, due to the dispute over the territory between India and Pakistan. This has resulted in three generations of WPRs living in poverty, with little access to opportunities for education and employment. Despite the unrest in Kashmir and the challenges faced by the WPRs, there is hope for change as the Hindu nationalist Bharatiya Janata Party has won a share of power in the state and is expected to champion the WPRs' cause. However, the WPRs are prepared to take matters into their own hands if their hopes for improved rights and conditions are not met.",

" FC Tokyo forward Yoshinori Muto, 22, has admitted he is considering a move to Chelsea, who have made an offer for him, reportedly around Â£4 million. Muto is a Japan international who scored the winner against Shonan Bellmare last week and is thinking about joining a club where he can play regularly and develop. Former FC Tokyo manager Ranko Popovic, who gave Muto his debut, believes he has the potential to be a big hit at Chelsea, describing him as an intelligent player with great speed and confidence. Chelsea manager Jose Mourinho is aware of Muto and has admitted that commercial interests play a part in the club's transfer policy, but insists that they only sign good players or good prospects. Muto is currently considering his options and wants to join a club where he can play and develop.",

' The passage praises Australia for selecting their best players, including those playing overseas, for international rugby matches. It highlights the cases of Matt Giteau and Drew Mitchell, who have improved their performance playing for Toulon. The text argues that England should adopt the same approach and not be restricted by the location of their players. It mentions Steffon Armitage and Nick Abendanon as examples of players who have improved after moving abroad. The passage emphasizes the importance of selecting the best team to win the Rugby World Cup, which England will host, and criticizes the English Rugby Football Union (RFU) and Premiership Rugby for restricting the selection of overseas players. It concludes by commending Australia for their approach and urging England to follow suit.',

" The passage discusses Open Garden's new device, Greenstone, which strengthens off-the-grid networks. Greenstone is a small, egg-shaped gadget that acts like a beacon or booster to help messages move around wireless mesh networks more easily. The Firechat app, developed by Open Garden, launched last year and has been downloaded over 5 million times.
