It uses a feature called Multipeer Connectivity Framework (MCF) in Apple's iOS 7 and a similar feature in Android to send messages and photos without a mobile or data signal, creating a wireless mesh network that connects phones to each other within 30 feet (9 meters). Greenstone aims to extend the range of message transmission beyond the current 200ft (61 meters) limit.\n\nFirechat users can send messages securely and anonymously using screen names, and data is sent from app usernames instead of mobile numbers. Greenstone is still under development and currently works with Firechat within a range of 20ft (6 meters). It has a one-year battery life and can hold up to 1,000 of the most recent messages. Open Garden plans to work with manufacturers to design and sell Greenstone, but no specific timeframe has been provided. Greenstone could be beneficial in situations where resilient communication is needed, such as in communities, neighborhoods, hospitals, music festivals, organized protests, and football matches.",

" Lillian Bustle, a burlesque performer from New Jersey, is challenging negative perceptions of the word 'fat' by embracing it as a body-positive description of her own physique. During a TED talk, she discussed how 'fat' should not be equated with 'ugly' and that exposure to body diversity can increase acceptance of different body types. Bustle, who is 5'3'' and weighs 2",

" Theo Walcott, an Arsenal winger who has spent much of the 2014-2015 season on the bench, was recently part of a photoshoot for Lanvin, Arsenal's official tailor since 2013. The photoshoot included other Arsenal players such as Calum Chambers, Jack Wilshere, Mikel Arteta, David Ospina, Mathieu Flamini, and Mesut Ozil, as well as runway model Olga Sherer. The Arsenal first team stars, including Walcott, will be dressed in Lanvin-made attire for their FA Cup final encounter against Aston Villa on May 30. Walcott has been named on Arsenal's substitutes' bench for 17 of their 33 Barclays Premier League games and made a brief appearance in the final minutes of their recent 0-0 draw with Chelsea. He hopes to make his first Arsenal start since their 3-0 win over West Ham on March 14 in their upcoming match against Hull.",

' An auction of props and puppets created by renowned make-up effects artist Rick Baker, from blockbuster films such as Men in Black, Batman Forever, How the Grinch Stole Christmas, and more, will take place at the Hilton Universal City in Los Angeles and on propstore.com on May 29. The collection, worth an estimated $746,100, includes items like the Edgar Bug alien from Men in Black valued at $40,000, the Two Face mask from Batman Forever valued at $1,500, and the Grinch costume from How the Grinch Stole Christmas valued at $8,000. Other items from films like An American Werewolf in London, Planet of the Apes, Batman & Robin, Hellboy, and Mighty Joe Young will also be sold.',

" The seven-year-old British boy, Carwyn Scott-Howell, died after falling over a 164ft drop in the French Alps while skiing with his family. He was a daring, outgoing, and determined youngster who loved the mountains and helping on the family farm. Carwyn, who modeled himself after TV adventurer Bear Grylls, had become separated from his mother and headed into dense woodland. His mother, Ceri, searched for him after he didn't return to the hotel. His body was found after investigators followed footprints in the snow. Carwyn's family is devastated by his death, describing a vast void in their hearts and remembering him as an adorable, caring person who made life full of laughter. He was a very competent skier and snowboarder who had started skiing at the age of three. The family had been enjoying a ski holiday together in Flaine before the tragedy struck. Carwyn's friends and schoolmates in Wales have also expressed their condolences.",

' The passage is about Laura Scurr, a 15-year-old girl from Whitley Bay, who developed anorexia at the age of 13 due to her obsession with having the perfect figure. She became so thin that she survived on just one piece of fruit a day, which led to her body shutting down and collapsing from starvation. Laura was rushed to the hospital and spent a week on a heart monitor. She received support from eating disorder organizations and began her recovery. The passage also highlights the pressures young girls face to be thin and the unrealistic size zero stereotypes in society. Laura has now regained her health and confidence and has made it to the semi-final of Miss Teen GB, a contest that promotes positive experiences for young girls away from size zero stereotypes.',

" Raheem Sterling, Daniel Sturridge, Martin Skrtel, and Simon Mignolet modeled Liverpool's new home kit for the 2015/16 season, designed by New Balance, who recently signed a Â£ 300million four-year kit deal with the club. Fans gathered at Anfield to see the players in the new gingham design, which includes a memorial flame and number 96 in tribute to the Hillsborough disaster victims. Sterling, who rejected a Â£ 100,000-a-week contract offer from Liverpool, was questioned about his future, but the club is adamant he will stay. The players also expressed their excitement about playing in the FA Cup semi-final against Aston Villa at Wembley.",

" A high-definition map of dark matter, the largest of its kind, has been created using data from the Dark Energy Survey (DES) and the Dark Energy Camera. The map shows clumps of dark matter across 0.4% of the sky, with red indicating more dark matter and blue less. The goal is to map 12.5% of the entire sky over five years. The map will help astronomers study how galaxies formed in the universe. Dark matter, which makes up at least 80% of the matter in the known universe, cannot be directly observed, but its effects on galaxies can be studied. The DES is also studying dark energy, which is believed to be causing the expansion of the universe to speed up. The map was created by measuring the shapes of galaxies and looking for the noticeable effect of dark matter on them. The survey will continue to expand, allowing for better testing of current cosmological theories. The team at the University of Manchester spent two years on the project and used some of the world's largest supercomputers to measure the shape of each galaxy with high precision.",

" Manchester United has made an official approach to sign PSV Eindhoven's 21-year-old star Memphis Depay, with manager Louis Van Gaal eager to make him one of his first summer signings. Depay, who played under Van Gaal during the 2014 World Cup, is enjoying a prolific season with 20 goals in 26 league games. PSV confirmed contact with United, Paris Saint-Germain, and another European club, with higher amounts of money involved compared to Tottenham's Â£15 million bid last summer. Depay, born in 1994, started playing for VV Moordrecht at six, then joined Sparta Rotterdam, and moved to PSV at 12. He made his first-team debut in 2011 and signed his first professional contract in 2012. Depay has been tipped to become as good as Dutch star Arjen Robben and even compared to a young Cristiano Ronaldo by those who scouted both players. He is known for his pace, dribbling skills, and shooting ability, but still has areas to improve at his young age. Depay has also made an impact on the international stage, scoring for the Netherlands in the 2014 World Cup.",

" Chelsea won the match 3-1 against Manchester City in the Youth Cup final, with goals from Tammy Abraham (2) and Dominic Solanke. Tosin Adarabioyo and Cameron Humphreys-Grant stood out for Manchester City in defense, while Brandon Barker was their star player. Chelsea's Jake Clarke-Salter and Ola Aina also had strong performances. Tammy Abraham scored his 35th and 36th goals of the season, while Dominic Solanke's goal effectively sealed the tie. Chelsea's Charlie Colkett and Manchester City's Kean Bryan played well in midfield despite injuries.",

" Marco Rubio, a presidential candidate and Florida senator, stated that people are born with their sexual preference, but he doesn't believe same-sex marriage should be a constitutional right. Rubio prefers that state legislatures decide on the definition of marriage, indicating that he personally believes marriage should be between one man and one woman. He also mentioned that, despite his disagreement with same-sex marriage, he would attend the wedding of a family member or staffer if they chose to have one. Rubio has announced his presidential candidacy and has already received significant financial commitments for his campaign.",

' Pablo Mandado and Ilze Zebolde are a couple who left their restaurant jobs in Manchester to cycle around the world with no plans or agenda, living on less than three euros each a day. They have been on their journey for over a year, having covered almost 7,000 miles and gone through 16 countries. They camp most of the time, using hosting websites and the kindness of strangers for accommodation. They mainly eat pasta, bread, rice, eggs, milk, seasonal fruits, and vegetables, and occasionally get invited for meals or receive free produce. They started in London and have cycled through France, Spain, Portugal, Italy, Slovenia, Croatia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Montenegro, Albania, Macedonia, Greece, Turkey, Georgia, and Armenia. They plan to continue through Asia and across the Pacific, aiming to cycle the entire length of the American continent.',

" A couple from Texas, who wishes to remain anonymous, is suing James Evans, owner of Premier Photos, for allegedly printing a racial slur on the bottom of some photo booth snapshots from their 2012 wedding. The bride's sister informed the family about the racist incident months after the celebration. The couple, represented by attorney Cathy Hale, is suing the company under the Texas Deceptive Trade Practices Act for negligence and breach of contract. Evans denies the allegations and a trial is set for July if mediation fails. The couple seeks an apology from Evans, not monetary compensation.",

" Mike Brown, an England full-back, is taking a cautious approach to recovering from his latest concussion, which he sustained during the match against Italy in the Six Nations. He has admitted that he is unsure when he will return to action for his club side, Harlequins, and wants to avoid an extended break. Brown was knocked out cold during the Italy match and had hoped to recover in time for the Ireland match, but had to pull out due to concussion symptoms. He credits increased awareness of concussion symptoms, driven by World Rugby online modules, for helping him realize he was not ready to face Ireland. Meanwhile, George North, a Northampton wing, has been advised by leading medics not to play again this season after suffering four quick-fire concussions. Ireland's Johnny Sexton was also stood down for 12 weeks earlier this season due to concussion. Brown is determined to be cautious and not rush his recovery, as he does not want to risk a long-term absence from the game.",

' The frequency of sexual activity among British couples has decreased since the 1990s, with a typical heterosexual couple now having sex three times a month, down from five times a month in 1990. This decline has been linked to the rise of the internet and smartphone use, which has blurred the lines between public and private life, leading to people constantly checking their emails and having less "quiet empty time." The increase in technological connectivity has also made lives busier, leaving less time for sexual activity. Additionally, more people are living alone, and with competing demands on time, sex has become a lower priority.\n\nThe statistician, David Spiegelhalter, suggests that the constant connectivity and busyness has squeezed out time that would have been spent with partners, and researcher Catherine Mercer adds that dealing with work emails late in the evening can make it difficult to focus on one\'s partner at bedtime.',

" Tibetan Mastiffs, a breed traditionally used for herding in Tibet and known for their loyalty, have experienced a dramatic decline in popularity in China. This is due to several factors, including the Chinese government's anti-corruption crackdown which reduced the practice of gifting the dogs to officials, and city bans on owning dogs over 50 kg. The breed's decline has led to a glut of poor-quality dogs and a rise in theft and slaughter for their meat and leather. Once a status symbol with a puppy selling for a record Â£1.2 million in 2019, the breed is now often found in cramped cages, being transported to slaughterhouses.",

' A survey of 600 women in Paris found that every woman has experienced some form of sexual harassment on public transport, with half of them experiencing it before the age of 18. The harassment ranges from insults and unwanted comments to physical attacks and rape. Six out of ten women are afraid of being attacked on public transport, which leads them to alter their daily lives to avoid confrontation. The survey results led to calls for a campaign to stop sexist or threatening behavior on buses and trains. Sexual assault is punishable by a five-year prison term and a fine of â¬ 75,005. The report highlights the need to educate women and men about what constitutes sexual harassment and assault, and to ensure that women can move about freely and safely in public spaces.',

" Direct Line, a Leeds-based company, ran a competition called #everydayfix asking for product designs to solve common daily problems. Three prototypes were shortlisted: Snooze, an alarm clock that silences phone notifications for better sleep; Forget Me Lock, a device that shows if your front door is locked via a key attachment; and Nipper, the world's smallest mobile phone charger. These prototypes are the result of a design makeathon with Makerversity, where groups created solutions for top ten everyday emergencies, including losing keys, traffic, and low phone battery. The winning product will be funded through a Kickstarter campaign, based on a Twitter poll with the #everydayfix hashtag.",
